org.gvsig.tools.swing.impl.usability.text

Class JStandardizedTextArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
            • javax.swing.JTextArea
              • org.gvsig.tools.swing.impl.usability.text.JStandardizedTextArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable

    public class JStandardizedTextArea
extends javax.swing.JTextArea
    According to the gvSIG's GUI style sheet all the TextAreas in the application will have a normative size. No smaller than a concrete size, and big enough to contain the text and avoiding the "..." characters. The TextArea will grow up in width by a set of widths defined in this style sheet, always choosing the smallest width that can contain the text. If the biggest width is not enought for this purpose then the TextArea will automatically grow up to the smallest necessary width to fit the text.

    The TextArea resizing is based on the setText(String txt) method. However, it is possible to use a custom size if you invoke one of setSize(..), setBorders(...) or setPreferredSize(...) after invoking the setText(...) method.

    This class is just a standard javax.swing.JTextArea that handles this issue.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form
